shortcuts.content: Analyze this job posting and provide a comprehensive assessment for whether I should apply. FinSight: AI financial analysis tool (React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Claude API) - 2 weeks 2. JobNest: Job tracker with AI cover letters (React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Claude API) - 2 weeks 3. Legends Archive: TypeScript migration + testing suite (TypeScript, MongoDB, Jest) - 3 days  Work Experience: - Technical Sales Account Manager at Preston Phipps (2024-2025): $1M+ pipeline, technical solution design - Independent Music Producer (2020-2024): $300K+ revenue, 100M+ streams, managed developers/designers - Mechanical Engineering degree with programming coursework (MATLAB, Python)  What I'm Targeting: - Entry-level to Junior Full-Stack Developer roles - Companies that explicitly welcome bootcamp graduates - Modern tech stack (React, Node.js, TypeScript preferred) - Team environments with mentorship opportunities - Willing to consider: Frontend-focused, Backend-focused, or Full-Stack roles  What I'm Avoiding: - Roles requiring 3+ years of professional software experience - Senior/Mid-level positions (unless they explicitly say \

) - Positions requiring deep expertise in technologies I haven't used (e.g., Java, C++, .NET) - Roles with extensive DevOps/Infrastructure focus (though basic Docker is fine) - Companies with poor culture indicators (see red flags below)  ---  ANALYSIS FRAMEWORK:  Please analyze the job posting and provide the following:  ## 1. - Green flag: Work-life balance mentioned, clear growth path, diversity initiatives  ## 3. shortcuts.name: /cover-letter
shortcuts.description: Generate tailored cover letter for a job posting
shortcuts.content: Generate a tailored cover letter for this job posting. Analyze the job description and requirements, then write a cover letter that highlights the most relevant aspects of my background.  **MY BACKGROUND:**  Personal Info: - Name: Ryan Nerby - Current Status: Full-Stack Software Engineer (recent bootcamp graduate, actively seeking first full-time role) - Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada - Contact: ryan.nerby@queensu.ca  Education: - Bachelor of Applied Science (BASc) in Mechanical Engineering - Queen's University (2016-2020)   - Coursework included programming (MATLAB, Python), numerical modeling, software-aided design   - Developed strong problem-solving fundamentals and analytical thinking - Full-Stack Software Engineering Program - Codeworks (2025)   - Intensive bootcamp covering modern web development, algorithms, systems architecture   - Built and deployed multiple production-ready projects   - Technologies: React, Node.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Express.js, Next.js, Jest, Docker  Technical Skills: - Frontend: React, Next.js, Angular.js, Redux, Tailwind CSS - Backend: Node.js, Express.js, Koa, Ruby on Rails - Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB - Languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, SQL, Ruby - Testing/Tools: Jest, Supertest, Git, GitHub, Postman, Docker - AI Integration: Claude API, REST API design - Methodologies: Agile workflows, TDD, CI/CD  Key Projects (use these to demonstrate skills):  1. FinSight - AI-Powered Financial Due Diligence Tool    - Built full-stack SaaS platform for automating financial analysis of small business acquisitions    - Tech stack: React.js, Node.js, Express.js, PostgreSQL, Tailwind CSS, Claude API    - Created document ingestion pipeline for PDFs/Excel/CSVs to structure raw financial data    - Integrated Claude API for automated ratio calculations, anomaly detection, and risk flagging    - Designed executive dashboard with traffic-light scoring system and exportable reports    - Reduced due diligence time from 8-20 hours to <90 seconds    - Key achievement: Built hybrid AI approach (AI for insights + deterministic calculations for accuracy)  2. JobNest - AI-Powered Job Application Tracker    - Full-stack job search platform with AI cover letter generation    - Tech stack: React, Node.js, Express.js, PostgreSQL, Tailwind CSS, Claude API    - Integrated Claude API for personalized cover letter generation tailored to job postings    - Built responsive analytics dashboard with real-time filtering and status tracking    - Implemented bulk operations with transactional integrity    - Optimized PostgreSQL queries (reduced search time from 2s to <500ms with indexing)  3. Legends Archive - Competition Car History Platform    - Web platform for managing and presenting vehicle histories    - Tech stack: TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Jest, Supertest    - Led migration from JavaScript to TypeScript, improving reliability and maintainability    - Implemented comprehensive testing suite with high coverage on models and API endpoints    - Configured separate test database with automatic cleanup for CI/CD reliability  Relevant Work Experience:  1. Technical Sales Account Manager - Preston Phipps Inc. (2024-2025)    - Partnered with engineers, contractors, and end-users to scope complex HVAC solutions    - Bridged technical needs with business requirements    - Built $1M+ pipeline, closed $500K+ in first year    - Managed full sales cycle from technical discovery to implementation    - Developed strong cross-functional communication and solution design skills    - Key takeaway: Learned to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders  2. Independent Music Producer (2020-2024)    - Built digital music brand generating 100M+ streams and $300K+ revenue    - Led freelance designers and developers to deliver digital assets and web platforms    - Negotiated contracts with Universal Music Group, secured software sponsorships    - Established online presence with 30M+ views across social media    - Key takeaway: Entrepreneurial mindset, self-directed learning, project management  Unique Value Propositions (emphasize these based on job requirements): - Engineering background provides strong problem-solving fundamentals and analytical thinking - Technical sales experience = ability to understand user needs and communicate technical concepts clearly - Built three production applications from scratch in short timeframes - Experience integrating AI APIs thoughtfully (understanding limitations, building hybrid systems) - Self-taught and fast learner (successfully transitioned from mechanical engineering to software) - Business understanding from running independent venture ($300K+ revenue) - Strong communication skills from technical sales and content creation  What I'm Looking For: - Entry-level to junior full-stack software engineering positions - Companies that value bootcamp graduates and invest in junior developer growth - Opportunity to work with modern tech stack (React, Node.js, TypeScript) - Collaborative team environment where I can learn from experienced engineers - Roles where I can apply both technical skills and business understanding  Cover Letter Guidelines: 1. Length: 250-350 words maximum (recruiters are busy) 2. Tone: Professional but authentic, no corporate jargon or AI-sounding language 3. Structure:    - Opening: Why I'm excited about THIS specific role/company (reference something specific from job posting)    - Body: 2-3 concrete examples of relevant experience (use specific projects/achievements)    - Closing: Clear call to action, enthusiasm about contributing to team 4. What to avoid:    - Generic statements like \
or \
- Listing every technology I know    - Phrases like \
(show, don't tell)    - Overly formal language (\
)    - AI-sounding phrases (\
) 5. What to include:    - Specific technical achievements with metrics (e.g., \

)    - Connection between my unique background and the role requirements    - Genuine enthusiasm for the company's mission/product/tech stack    - One standout project that's most relevant to this role  Customization Instructions: - Read the job description carefully and identify the 2-3 most important requirements - Choose the most relevant project(s) from my portfolio to highlight - If job mentions specific technologies I've used, reference my experience with them - If job emphasizes team collaboration, mention Agile workflows and bootcamp teamwork - If job values learning/growth, emphasize my career transition and fast learning - If company is in fintech, emphasize FinSight; if product-focused, emphasize understanding of user needs from technical sales - Match the tone to the company (startup = more casual, enterprise = more formal)  Example opening variations (choose based on company type): - For startups: \
